title: (x) Clarendon sans? Belizio monoline? - various {gang}
content:
hi there,   
do you know any remakes of clarendon/belizio or a clarendon/belizio-inspired font ? A semisans-version which only leaves the "bubbles" (and curves)? An "Egizio Isonorm"?

 [‹ (x) Bembo-like typeface - HTF Requiem {Addison, Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060435/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4845 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Typeface query: Trooper ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060435/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4835 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: Not really a Clarendon Sans, but a nice Clarendon / Belizio adaptation nonetheless, and I just loove ' [Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060435/http:/www.stormtype.com/farao.html)', by [Frantisek Storm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060435/http:/www.stormtype.com/).. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060435im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

I think that's the first time I've laughed out loud clicking through a link to font I've not seen before.   
   
I'm not sure I'll find a use for it, but I think I'll have to try and find one.   
   
My immediate thought was of Ronald Searle illustrations.   
   
Edit:   
These are the delusional Sunday night ramblings of somebody looking at [Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060435/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/farao/farao/testdrive.html?s=St%2BTrinian%92s&p=72)

Yves, Thanks for posting the link to 'Fantabular Sans', by MVB..   
That would be a good choice and alternative, for sure..   
   
_And, note to self, I have to add MVB to my type book marks, right now.._

hm, my reply went away, so i just wanna say thank you for the fantabular-link again.   
and if you know something like fantabular non-monospace ....
